result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Dismissed and read-in 15 CF 171 and 15 CM 149

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jose Alvin Moreno in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant Jose Alvin Moreno in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Defendant entered NC plea.  Court finds defendant guilty.

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 3 years - costs  $518.00 - 231 days county jail with credit for 231 days time served - 
      15 CF 158 is dismissed and read-in

15 CM 149:  State moved to amend to straight DC 947.01(1) - Court grants motion to amend to 947.01(1)  -  plea of nc entered - found guilty - 

Court:  Sentence w/held probation 1 year - costs $443.00 - 231 days county jail with credit for 231 days time served 
       15 CF 158 is dismissed and read-in 

15 CF 158:  Dismissed and read-in

Defendant Jose Alvin Moreno in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant Jose Alvin Moreno in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Acknowledges receipt of information - NG plea, request trial dates on all cases each 1 day  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jose Alvin Moreno in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant Jose Alvin Moreno in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DEF advised of rights.  DEF waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause, DEF bound over for trial.   Arraignment scheduled for December 15, 2015 @ 8:15am.

Defendant Jose Alvin Moreno in court, in custody, with attorney Jamy Richard Johansen appearing by telephone in Rusk County Courtroom (Judge Anderson by video.)  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Atty Johansen reports that no attorney has yet been assigned for DEF in this case, (he represents DEF in 15CM149).  This case will be set for scheduling Initial appearance as soon as counsel is assigned.
DEF states he would like to request a signature bond.  Atty Poquette responds.  Court will hear motion when Counsel is assigned to case.

Defendant Jose Alvin Moreno in court with attorney Jamy Richard Johansen appeared via phone.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 15 CM 149.  Courtreporter Shannon Golat appears via phone and the Court appears via video.  10:07 AM  Court calls cases and recites appearances.  15 CF 158 INIT / court questions the defendant as to court appearing via video.  Defendant does not object but would like the opportunity to speak to his atty, would like to speak to him before we go forward.  Atty Johansen addressed the Court has not been appointed to represent him on the felony case not the attorney of record on that file.  Court: questions Atty Poquette as to 15 CF 158, who states we do not have to do anything further on this case as bond was set yesterday.  Court we will revisit 15 CF 158 - this will be adjourned so defendant can speak to his attorney on this case, advised him to contact the public defender's office to get Mr. Johansen appointed to this case also.  

15 CF 158 will be set for INIT 7/17/15 at 1:00 PM.  
Defendant addressed the Court - court advised him to talk to his attorney

15 CM 149:  Atty Johansen makes stmt defers to the state / State makes stmt requests hold off until we handle 15 CF 158 STC tomorrow  Initial appearance scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No consumption of Alcoholic Beverages
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, No Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.

Defendant Jose Alvin Moreno in court, in custody appearing by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court sets bond.
Initial appearance set to be heard by Judge Steve Anderson on general assignment, as case 15CM149 is scheduled to be heard tomorrow.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
